result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Justin P. Ligman was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program, if probation revoked.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay fine/costs 
*Bond monies to be applied to fine/costs. 
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
*Provide DNA sample
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if not already done so - if completed then comply with treatment recommendations - agent can accept the DOT Assessment if deemed appropriate

timeConds.notes:

*2nd half of jail sentence to be served on electronic home monitor, if approved by risk assessment 
*30 days to start jail sentence 
*Report today for start date

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin P. Ligman in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:59 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - Dismissed

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 and Count 2 is Dismissed.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 5 year prison sentence
 30 months of initial confinement and 30 months extended supervision
Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program if probation revoked.  

Placed on Probation for 36 months:
**Conditions of Probation:
6 months jail sentence
1 day jail credit
Huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
2nd half of jail sentence to be served on electronic home monitor if approved by risk assessment 
30 days to start jail sentence 
Report to jail today for start date
Pay fine of $1,200 plus costs totalling $2,502.00
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
Provide DNA sample
36 months DL revocation
36 month IID on vehicles owned or operated by the defendant
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if not already done so - if completed then comply with treatment recommendations - agent can accept the DOT assessment if deemed appropriate.
Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
Bond monies to be applied to fines/costs

Count 2 - Dismissed
 
20 days to appeal

Defendant Justin P. Ligman in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:35 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matter is before the Court on the Defendant's motion, attacking prior convictions.

Atty Redfield presents an extra copy for the Court, cannot locate motion in the file.

Atty Redfield addresses the Court, would like to call his client to the witness stand.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, filed a response to the motion to attack. 

Court will give the Defendant an opportunity to testify and the State can cross examine those issues brought up.

1:40 PM Justin Ligman is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Redfield.
State has no questions for this witness.

Atty Redfield has no further witnesses.

State has no witnesses.

Atty Redfield addresses the Court regarding the motion, this should be treated as an OWI 3rd.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court regarding the motion.

Atty Redfield replies.

Court has heard testimony and reviewed the documents in the file presented by each of the parties. Court reviews traffic record printout.
Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies collateral attacks and will count to prior convictions. This case would be a 5th offense.

Court did find copy of motion in file, extra copy is returned to Atty Redfield.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.
